keyword: how many calories in a pear
title: How Many Calories Are in a Pear?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pear, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and more in label-style nutrition facts with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Pear?
assumptions: Medium-sized pear (~178 g), raw, with skin, ripe but not overripe; no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pear variety, size, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specifics when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium pear provides about 101 kcal and 5.5 g of dietary fiber.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium pear?
faqs.a: Approximately 101 kcal for one medium pear (~178 g).

faqs.q: Does a pear have a lot of fiber?
faqs.a: Yes, about 5.5 g of dietary fiber per medium pear, aiding digestion.
Very low—only 0.2 g total fat per medium pear, with no saturated or trans fats.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in a pear?
faqs.a: Around 17 g of natural sugars per medium pear, mostly from fructose.

faqs.q: Do calories vary by pear size?
faqs.a: Yes—small pears (~148 g) have ~84 kcal, large (~230 g) ~130 kcal.
